channel.title: Putting my server actually online
channel.description: I know this is probably a common asked question, but I honestly need help. I've watched several tutorials on port-forwarding and creating hosts, etc. But, it doesn't actually show putting your ip into the client or creating a .rar client. I'm not trying to leech, I just want to have my buddy play while I code so he can essentially be my "beta tester". If someone can show me in teamviewer that'd be great just send me a PM on here about it. :confused: :confused: - Thanks. ;)

item.title: Putting my server actually online
item.dc:creator: @Tricky_Stuff Tricky Stuff
item.description:
@Tricky_Stuff wrote:

1800getk0ed:

well to be honest it matters on your source. what revision? and do you want teamviewer help? I am available in a few hours.

Alright, message me your details later. I’m pretty sure the revision is atleast 525+

Read full topic

item.title: Putting my server actually online
item.dc:creator: @Tricky_Stuff Tricky Stuff
item.description:
@Tricky_Stuff wrote:

[quote=“TimeRS3, post:2, topic:445484”]im gonna take it like i know what you saying but here i wont tell you exactly where to put stuff ill just tell where and what to put

client sided

  • go to client.java replace 127.0.0.1 with either your ip from whatsmyip.org or no-ip

next go to your router page the ones mostly used are 168.192.0.1 or 168.192.1.1 there are more like 2.1 or 1.2 but you would need to go in to your desktop go to start>run>cmd type in ipconfig and you would see all your info needed there

Portforwarding
go into your games applications or where ever your portforwarding stuff should be change your ip in there to the first ip you see in the cmd when you type ipconfig

save and your done do this for port triggering aswell if needed

your ported your server is online and your good to go make sure if you want to put your ip into client i suggest you use no-ip
just for your own computer safety[/quote]
i did all that, but im trying to use a different revision and it’s different. idk, im not that great at reading something then doing it, im more of a visual learner…

Read full topic

item.title: Putting my server actually online
item.dc:creator: @TimeRS3 TimeRS3
item.description:
@TimeRS3 wrote:

im gonna take it like i know what you saying but here i wont tell you exactly where to put stuff ill just tell where and what to put

client sided

  • go to client.java replace 127.0.0.1 with either your ip from whatsmyip.org or no-ip

next go to your router page the ones mostly used are 168.192.0.1 or 168.192.1.1 there are more like 2.1 or 1.2 but you would need to go in to your desktop go to start>run>cmd type in ipconfig and you would see all your info needed there

Portforwarding
go into your games applications or where ever your portforwarding stuff should be change your ip in there to the first ip you see in the cmd when you type ipconfig

save and your done do this for port triggering aswell if needed

your ported your server is online and your good to go make sure if you want to put your ip into client i suggest you use no-ip
just for your own computer safety

Read full topic

item.title: Putting my server actually online
item.dc:creator: @Tricky_Stuff Tricky Stuff
item.description:
@Tricky_Stuff wrote:

I know this is probably a common asked question, but I honestly need help. I’ve watched several tutorials on port-forwarding and creating hosts, etc. But, it doesn’t actually show putting your ip into the client or creating a .rar client. I’m not trying to leech, I just want to have my buddy play while I code so he can essentially be my “beta tester”. If someone can show me in teamviewer that’d be great just send me a PM on here about it.

  • Thanks.
